Nasty Plot.description: Gholdengo is a fearsome setup sweeper in Ubers UU, in part due to its terrifyingly strong signature move, potent signature ability, and fantastic defensive typing. Make It Rain allows Gholdengo to output huge damage and hit important targets like Kyurem-W, Baxcalibur, and Zacian, whereas Shadow Ball offers incredible neutral coverage while hitting Mewtwo, Giratina, and Galarian Slowking extremely hard. Recover allows Gholdengo to have incredible longevity alongside its immunity to status moves. Tera Water allows Gholdengo to turn its Fire weakness into a resistance, helping against Chi-Yu and Kyurem-W, while also providing a resistance to Water, which assists against Palkia-O and Palafin. Air Balloon gives Gholdengo a temporary Ground immunity, giving it more entry points through an immunity to Spikes, Earth Power, and Earthquake from Great Tusk and Landorus. Gholdengo pairs excellently with entry hazard setters such as Magearna and Skarmory, as it blocks both Rapid Spin and Defog. It can also break through some walls with its sheer power, like Clefable and Arceus-Grass, giving teammates like Zacian an easier time cleaning up. Gholdengo struggles with faster offensive Pokemon that can halt its sweep and revenge kill it, such as Dragapult and Tera Fire Zacian, so Pokemon like Deoxys, Palafin, and Rillaboom can help Gholdengo by handing them. Pokemon with strong priority moves, like Kingambit and Palafin, can also halt its sweep and revenge kill it, so teammates like Zamazenta-C and Palkia-O, which can take Sucker Punch and Jet Punch, respectively, provide excellent support for it.

Specially Defensive.description: Gholdengo is an excellent setup sweeper and support Pokemon in Ubers UU, in large part due to its fantastic defensive typing, its strong ability, and Nasty Plot. Hex allows Gholdengo to do huge damage to statused foes, like sleeping Giratina and statused Arceus formes. Thunder Wave allows Gholdengo to disrupt the enemy team, power up its Hex, and cripple offensive Pokemon like Zacian, Palkia-O, and Chi-Yu. Nasty Plot turns Gholdengo from a wall into a potential sweeper with Shadow Ball, being able to boost on Pokemon that rely on status or phazing, like Arceus-Poison if its Air Balloon is intact and Clefable. Air Balloon gives Gholdengo a temporary Ground-type and Spikes immunity, allowing it to switch in on Great Tusk and Landorus easily, and keep entry hazards on the field against Great Tusk. Tera Water allows Gholdengo to resist Water- and Fire-type moves from the likes of Chi-Yu, Kyurem-W, Palkia-O, and Palafin. Gholdengo can paralyze and beat foes like Zacian and Zamazenta-C, helping teammates such as Arceus-Dark and Kyurem-W that appreciate being faster than opposing threats. However, Gholdengo struggles with Dark-types like Kingambit and Arceus-Dark, so Pokemon like Magearna and Zamazenta-C pair excellently with it. Additionally, Gholdengo has natural synergy with entry hazard setters like Magearna, Galarian Slowking, Galvantula, and Skarmory, as it blocks both Rapid Spin and Defog, making it the best Pokemon for keeping hazards on the opponent's field.

Choice Scarf.description: Gholdengo is a decent option as a Choice Scarf user and revenge killer thanks to its great offensive and defensive typing. Focus Blast allows it to hit Kingambit, Dialga, and Choice Specs Chi-Yu, whereas Thunderbolt can be used instead for Palafin and Toxapex. Trick cripples opposing Pokemon like Magearna and Dialga, which could otherwise wall Gholdengo. As Choice Scarf Gholdengo is unable to run a damage-boosting item, it sometimes lacks in damage. Tera Steel makes up for this by allowing it to OHKO Mewtwo after Stealth Rock and OHKO Great Tusk; Tera Steel also removes its weaknesses to the Dark- and Ghost-type attacks that would otherwise force it out like Sucker Punch from Kingambit, Shadow Ball from Mewtwo, and Judgment from Arceus-Dark. Tera Fighting is used exclusively on Focus Blast sets to turn Gholdengo's Sucker Punch weakness into a resistance while also allowing it to OHKO Zamazenta-C and offensive Dialga. Gholdengo is one of the most reliable forms of entry hazard control in the tier, as its immunity to both Rapid Spin and Defog allows it to keep hazards up with ease. Therefore, hazard setters like Magearna, Skarmory, and Deoxys-S make for excellent partners. Primarily used as a revenge killer, Gholdengo is excellent at enabling other premier offensive cleaners like Zacian, Ogerpon-H, and Kingambit by punching through their potential checks like Clefable and Dondozo, while also crippling Giratina with Trick. Gholdengo struggles against teams that contain strong priority users like Palafin and Kingambit, so Pokemon that can take hits from them, like Arceus-Grass, Archaludon, Toxapex, and Palkia-O are desirable partners.

Swords Dance.description: Swords Dance Chien-Pao is one of the strongest cleaners in the tier, easily finding opportunities to set up with how many switches it forces. Sucker Punch can be used to beat out the few Pokemon that can revenge kill Chien-Pao such as Deoxys and Palafin. Sacred Sword and Tera Blast Fire or Ground are niche coverage options that can be used to deal with Zamazenta-C and Magearna. Tera Dark boosts Chien-Pao's Crunch and Sucker Punch to astronomical levels of power, while Tera Fire and Tera Ground can award Chien-Pao with further setup opportunities by providing immunities to Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave, respectively. Swords Dance Chien-Pao appreciates wallbreakers such as Mewtwo, Palafin, and Palkia-O that can tear holes in the opponent's team, paving the way for a late-game sweep. Chien-Pao particularly dislikes Fairy-types such as Magearna and Zacian; some strong options that can deal with them are Landorus-T, Chi-Yu, and Arceus-Poison. Chien-Pao also greatly appreciates entry hazard setters and bulky pivots that can help chip down the opponent's team and safely bring it in. For this reason, Magearna and Landorus-T pair very well with it.

Choice Specs.description: Thanks to Walking Wake's great STAB combination that threatens out Pokemon like Great Tusk, Giratina, and Palkia-O; great Special Attack and Speed; powerful ability in Protosynthesis; and spammable signature move in Hydro Steam, it is one of Ubers UU's best sun attackers. Flamethrower targets Steel- and Grass-types like Magearna, Zamazenta-C, Arceus-Grass, and Corviknight. Flip Turn allows Walking Wake to take advantage of the switches it forces against Pokemon like Chi-Yu and Landorus and gain momentum for its team. 244 EVs in Special Attack allow Walking Wake to gain a Speed boost under sun, making it a strong cleaner and revenge killer. Tera Water boosts Hydro Steam and Flip Turn, allowing Walking Wake to reach damage thresholds such as OHKOing Mewtwo and Magearna under sun. Walking Wake fits exclusively on sun teams and is mandatory on them. Torkoal is the most automatic partner for Walking Wake, as it sets the sun needed for Walking Wake to be at its fullest potential while also spinning away entry hazards and setting up Stealth Rock to wear down would-be switchins to Walking Wake like Magearna. Great Tusk is also a notable partner, as it removes entry hazards as well and can deal with the Steel-types Waking Wake can struggle against. Other sun wallbreakers like Chi-Yu and Ogerpon-H can break through Walking Wake's checks like Magearna and Blissey and give it an easier time punching holes in the opposing team. Pivots like Landorus-T can create a good pivoting core with Walking Wake.

Swords Dance.description: Ogerpon-H is an incredibly potent stallbreaker and sweeper in Ubers UU due to Mold Breaker and Swords Dance. Trailblaze allows Ogerpon-H to boost its Speed past that of usually faster Pokemon, such as Deoxys, Dragapult, Zacian, Choice Scarf Chi-Yu, and Choice Scarf Landorus. Power Whip and Horn Leech can be run as stronger Grass-type moves to hit Palafin and Great Tusk for super effective damage. Ivy Cudgel gives Ogerpon-H a strong, non-contact Fire-type STAB move to hit Magearna and Skarmory with while avoiding Rocky Helmet chip damage. Play Rough is for Dragon-types like Giratina and Reshiram that resist its STAB moves, whereas Knock Off is for general utility and hits Mewtwo and Lugia. Terastallizing Ogerpon-H gives it an Attack boost, letting it grab OHKOs on bulky neutral Pokemon like Zacian and Dialga without a Swords Dance boost. Ogerpon-H is best dealt with using offensive counterplay that takes advantage of its poor bulk, as Pokemon like Deoxys, Zacian, Choice Scarf Landorus, Chi-Yu, and Palafin can outrun and KO it. Defensively, almost nothing can take Ogerpon-H on, as Mold Breaker ignores Unaware, so only the likes of Moltres can safely handle it. Entry hazards are also a huge problem for Ogerpon-H, as it cannot hold Heavy-Duty Boots, meaning it will take significant chip damage when hitting the battlefield. Ogerpon-H especially appreciates support from Corviknight, which can help Ogerpon-H safely hit the field and remove hazards. Ogerpon-H also forms strong offensive cores with priority users like Rillaboom, Palafin, and Arceus formes due to them being able to eliminate the few faster threats in the metagame. Ogerpon-H also pairs uniquely well with Sticky Web Galvantula, as the foes' Speed drops let it move before everything in the unboosted metagame besides priority users, making it much more threatening.

All-out Attacker.description: Ogerpon-H is a fearsome wallbreaker and late-game cleaner in Ubers UU. Power Whip is a strong STAB option, hitting important damage thresholds on Great Tusk, Toxapex, and Arceus formes, but Horn Leech's healing effect can offset chip damage from entry hazards, making it a solid alternative. Play Rough hits Dragon-types like Giratina and Palkia-O hard. Trailblaze boosting Ogerpon-H's Speed allows it to outpace most of the metagame, notably Zacian, Mewtwo, Deoxys, and Arceus formes. Tera Fire boosts Ogerpon-H's damage meteorically, allowing it to OHKO Pokemon like Zacian, Landorus, and Palkia-O. Ogerpon-H can have issues breaking through Pokemon like bulky Arceus formes and Giratina without Terastalizing, as they can shrug off its coverage moves, so Pokemon that can break through these threats like Palkia-O, Zacian, and Ice Beam Mewtwo are excellent partners. Ogerpon-H's wallbreaking prowess makes it an excellent partner to late-game cleaners like Zacian, Chi-Yu, and Kyurem-W, which appreciate it beating Pokemon like Dondozo, Solgaleo, and Magearna that could otherwise stop their sweep. Ogerpon-H's also cannot hold Heavy-Duty Boots, as it is locked into using Hearthflame Mask, so hazard control from Great Tusk and Giratina is appreciated.

Rain Sweeper.description: Archaludon is an excellent rain sweeper and wallbreaker thanks to the combination of its movepool, typing, and ability allowing it to threaten a large part of the metagame with super effective damage while withstanding a lot of damage thanks to Stamina and Assault Vest. Electro Shot allows Archaludon to increase its Special Attack while in rain and provides valuable coverage against Skarmory and Dondozo, and the combination of Body Press and Stamina allows it to deal damage to specially defensive Pokemon like Blissey and Dialga, which it would otherwise struggle against. Tera Fairy allows Archaludon to resist Fighting-type attacks and gives it a Dragon-type immunity, flipping the matchup against Pokemon like Palkia-O and Zacian. Tera Flying can be used instead, giving it a Ground-type immunity to avoid getting revenge killed by Landorus-I or Great Tusk, although this comes with the significant drawback of making it weak to Stealth Rock. The HP and Defense EVs allow Archaludon to take Close Combat from a +1 Zacian after one layer of Spikes, and 124 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed Palafin. Archaludon requires rain support to be at its fullest potential, which makes Pelipper the ideal partner with its access to Drizzle and U-turn to pivot Archaludon into the game. Strong Water-types like Palafin appreciate Archaludon's ability to defeat walls they struggle with such as Giratina and Toxapex. Archaludon struggles against faster Ground-types like offensive Great Tusk and Landorus, so Flying-types like Corviknight and faster offensive Water-types that can take care of them like Palkia-O and Barraskewda are excellent teammates. Additionally, Fighting-types like Zamzenta-C can give Archaludon trouble, so having Pokemon that can handle these threats like Giratina and Zacian is important. Archaludon is also very weak to hazards, making a hazard remover like Regieleki or Giratina being good teammate.
